title: IELTS Speaking notes
content:
Some points of the IELTS Speaking:








Discourse markers
Positive: sure, definitely ,of course
Negative: not at all, absolutely not, I am afraid not
Personal opinions: If you ask me(C2), to me, personally
Functions: to make the speech more natural and idiomatic
Basic formula for part one:Step 1:Response, discourse markers + answer the question directly with full sentences
Step 2:Extensions, the claw system,paralleling addition, comparison and example
Extension 1: The claw systemTo find out reasons behind the answer, we usually sum up reasons into 5 parts: Financial,Social, Environmental, Mental, Physical.
Financial: usually about money, to be more specific is living cost, job, economic growth, etc.
Social: usually about people, to me more specific is socializing, social group, etc.
Environmental: usually about location, atmosphere, vibe, environmental protection, etc.
Mental: usually about emotions and feelings.
Physical: usually about health and body figure and physical features.
Besides the claw system, there is a basic structure for giving reasons:



Cause conjunction
+
Objective reason
+
Subjective feeling



Because

Physical

Mental


as

Social

feelings


for

Financial

emotions


for the reason that

Environmental




owing to the fact that






PS: as can only be followed with Objective reason.
Extension 2: Paralleling additionUseful connectives: also, another reason is that, besides, by the way…
Extension 3: ComparisonUseful connectives: Differences: unlike, compared with, while, but, however
Similarities: like, similarly, in the same way, same as
Extension 4: ExampleUseful connectives: for example, for instance, I still remember
The way to give an example:
Conjunction + 4WH + Subjective feeling
4WH: when/ what/ where/ who
Overall framework for part 1Step 1: response
Learn different expressions and synonyms of “like” or “dislike”.
Step 2: extensions
Master different ways of extending your answers to show your willingness of communication.

title: My College Class
content:
Ming Yue Innovation ClassOne years ago, I finished my study in high school and entered university. Originally I was in the College of Mechanical and Vehicle Engineering, but there is a new kind of class held in our university. It is a kind of experimental class, and the tenet of this class is innovation. One thing this class is really different from the ordinary college is that students in this class can choose one of the four majors as their research direction. It is the kind of model that the Franklin W. Olin College of Engineering has, aiming to change the way of education. I have to say I fancy this class the moment I knew it, so I decided to apply for it.
The way the innovation Class choose students is not popular. For the ordinary experimental Class, the way they choose students is to hold a examination to see who is capable to enter this class. But for the innovation Class,   an interview and a project test are the two main method to select students.
Unexpectedly, I stood the racket and entered the innovation Class, whose full name is Ming Yue Innovation Class.

This is the Logo of the Innovation Class.
After becoming a member of this class, I gradually noticed that there is so many difference between my class and the ordinary class. What we learnt are ranging from Math, Physics, Software designing to Biology, Sketch, Humanistic Culture and Nature. Despite we have a diverse curriculum, we do have a main track that is Robotic Science and Artificial Intelligence. 
Nothing is perfect. We have our own weakness. Those subjects are really challenging and profound. Though we spent much time on those subjects, we can’t master it. And the reason is simple. The lack of the rudimentary knowledge is the main cause of this phenomenon.
There is still some ways to get out of trouble. One effective solution is to learn from the practice. For example, if you want to learn Machine Learning, you can start with some simple projects on GitHub, you don’t have to understand all the code in your projects at the beginning, but you have to know the framework of this project.
For me, I’ve done some projects to practise my coding skills, using Pygame to design a computer game, using Unreal Engine to design a VR game, using Vue and Java Script to design a WeChat program that can identify the numbers in the picture. Those projects aren’t really difficult, but we can improve our coding skills from it. Despite those programming stuff, I’ve also learnt to use PS, 3D modelling software. That is of great help to some projects. 
After all, I guess you still do not have a full understanding to my class. Later in my blog, I am going to tell you more about my class.
